name: TheAtlantic
text: Bird-watchers spotted a strange new type of song in western Canada's white-throated sparrows. Then, it suddenly spread across the entire country, @sarahzhang reports. https://t.co/h5S7NZRXC9

name: TheAtlantic
text: "For the second time in two weeks, Oklahomans have made President Donald Trump look bad," writes @GrahamDavidA. "First there was the sparsely attended Tulsa rally. Now Sooner State voters have opted to expand Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act." https://t.co/vFWyc2QCLs

name: TheAtlantic
text: “As Black women around the country once again so prominently lead efforts to curb racist violence, it’s stunningly hypocritical to affirm Black lives while turning a blind eye to the mistreatment that Black women endure,” @ethiopienne writes. https://t.co/vKHemWqhGj

name: TheAtlantic
text: The U.S. reported about 300,000 new cases of the coronavirus in the past week, more than any previous week of the pandemic. The ongoing surge is growing beyond the Sun Belt, straining the country’s ability to measure it, @yayitsrob reports: https://t.co/pYAcXporDo

name: TheAtlantic
text: Reading can feel hard right now. If you’re struggling to start a book, let us help: Writers and editors from around our newsroom offer inspiration from their own reading lists. The latest Atlantic Daily. https://t.co/wLEzqlziQs

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The NFL can only make a difference if those in positions of power... embrace this opportunity to make bold statements rather than maintain the status quo," @jemelehill writes: https://t.co/Xt7kvfsdsz

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I served under Barack Obama and George W. Bush, and I trusted that each one would uphold their end of the bargain with the military: We go into harm’s way, and they wage the war honorably and responsibly. This president is different," Tim Kudo writes. https://t.co/HyCXkvYwO2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: This great story from @bborrell is delightfully disgusting.  https://t.co/G1eLQLgyIb

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: "For months this spring, many of us stayed home, canceled vacations, and avoided friends and family. It was awful, but it worked...We are now losing that work, watching weeks of pandemic suppression vanish in days," @yayitsrob writes: https://t.co/zuygFYTqR0

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: Fun discussion on @TheAtlantic's Social Distance podcast between @jameshamblin, @katlwells, and @helenlewis on the need for schools to reopen: https://t.co/4HYJtAis2H

Read @helenlewis's piece here: https://t.co/iKPNwgHpWS

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: "It may not be Apartheid, which was a seminal and unique event," writes Hirsh Goodman, who moved to Israel from South Africa in 1965. "But it would be separation under one sovereignty by ethnicity—and that is a red line I cannot cross."

https://t.co/pcefG3tkEu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "This is an old story: We become what we behold. The project partakes of the spirit of a famous Republican president, all right. But he’s not Lincoln." -- Andrew Ferguson: 
https://t.co/b5Yz87E4Jg

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "We’re in an age when, for some, considering an immigrant a human being is a radical political act." -- @Lin_Manuel, in @TheAtlantic:
https://t.co/rphqHy0481

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "American leadership has politicized the pandemic instead of trying to fight it. I see no preparedness, no coordinated top-down leadership of the sort we’ve enjoyed in Europe," @thomaschattwill writes: https://t.co/nC0KN0Y1Sm

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mimbsy: starting a new book is hard right now! here's a peak at what our newsroom is reading, if you're looking for some inspiration: https://t.co/D6mmUR9iL5

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: Here is an article by @Lin_Manuel on the power of art in the time of Trump (via @TheAtlantic):
https://t.co/rphqHy0481

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: The country’s second surge of coronavirus infection is growing beyond the Sun Belt.

Sixteen states have reported record caseloads since Sunday. Ohio and Georgia are flashing warning signs. https://t.co/FpV56nVaAC

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: We're going to run out of ways to say how bad things are looking. https://t.co/zuygFYTqR0

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Saahil_Desai: The week America lost control of the pandemic https://t.co/TOHTeqzV0E

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: "Parents can’t wait around forever. As long as they have to stay home with children, they cannot truly participate in the workforce. The facts right now suggest reopening schools would not lead to disaster, but more info shouldn’t be so hard to come by" https://t.co/XV8tgouDS3

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos of the Week: A new waterslide in the Czech Republic, a cat on the Algerian waterfront, a grotto reopening in Italy, burying a coronavirus victim in Russia, a wildfire in Colorado, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/nQwnXWV1Lv

name: TheAtlantic
text: Almost 3 million American adults have moved in with their parents or grandparents during the pandemic. Perhaps it’s time for the country to revise its negative stereotypes about that living arrangement, @jpinsk writes. https://t.co/OHOzxtY9Nk

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I ran away from institutional racism; I cannot watch while my adopted country moves toward it now," Hirsh Goodman writes: https://t.co/4VNySVjJHj

name: TheAtlantic
text: The coronavirus pandemic is one reason Iowa's sleepy Senate race is suddenly one to watch, @elainejgodfrey writes. https://t.co/gFTf0gpP7v

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen: @jameshamblin and @katlwells talk about air conditioners, toilet plume, and how to limit your exposure to the coronavirus indoors. https://t.co/dq4vZugwK8

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Books Briefing: The influential role of platonic intimacy. https://t.co/ICX3Cd15IF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Flesh-eating bacteria are on the rise in the beach towns near Melbourne, Australia, and scientists are struggling to figure out why, @bborrell reports. https://t.co/hn5WgdR71L

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Baldwin put his whole life and body weight into these words, which, today more than ever, reverberate like a never-ending nightmare." Raoul Peck, the director of "I Am Not Your Negro," writes about heeding James Baldwin, more than 50 years later: https://t.co/6Phylalhn3

name: TheAtlantic
text: The time-capsule quality of “Hamilton,” now streaming on Disney+, can serve as a bracing throwback for new viewers and returning fans alike, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/YWf3JHnhoQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The numbers of American sick and dead are a source of wonder and marvel all over the world. They also inspire fear and anxiety," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/JfJOLABbnj

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Supreme Court on Thursday granted Alabama’s request to restore voting restrictions, including efforts that may limit absentee voting during the pandemic. @AdamHSays examines how voter suppression will affect the November election. https://t.co/Iwt5II4Ih7

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The numbers of American sick and dead are a source of wonder and marvel all over the world. They also inspire fear and anxiety," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/kRMWLsY6kx
